title: Malappuram
dis: It is the 4th largest urban agglomeration in Kerala and the 20th largest in India and a city in the Indian state of Kerala.

title: Thiruvananthapuram
dis: The capital city of Kerala, known for its beaches, backwaters, and historical sites like Padmanabhapuram Palace.

title: Kollam
dis: A city known for its cashew processing, backwaters, and beaches like Alleppey.

title: Pathanamthitta
dis: Home to Sabarimala temple, a Hindu pilgrimage site, and known for its backwaters and beaches.

title: Alappuzha
dis: Famous for its backwaters, houseboat cruises, and beaches like Mararikulam.

title: Kottayam
dis: Known for its backwaters, houseboat cruises, and Kumarakom, a popular tourist destination.

title: Idukki
dis: A hill station known for its wildlife sanctuaries, waterfalls like Athirappilly, and dams.

title: Ernakulam
dis: The largest commercial city in Kerala, known for its backwaters, beaches like Kochi, and historical sites.

title: Thrissur
dis: A cultural hub known for its temples, festivals like Thrissur Pooram, and classical art forms.

title: Palakkad
dis: Known for its historical sites like Palakkad Fort, wildlife sanctuaries, and scenic beauty.

title: Kozhikode
dis: A historical port city known for its beaches like Kappad, spices, and cultural heritage.

title: Wayanad
dis: A hill station known for its wildlife sanctuaries, plantations, and trekking trails.

title: Kannur
dis: A coastal city known for its beaches, forts like Kannur Fort, and theyyam performances.

title: Kasaragod
dis: The northernmost district of Kerala, known for its beaches, forts like Bekal Fort, and theyyam performances.
